Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ponericin G4  (natural AMPs; antss, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; ZZI; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Zone of inhibition test at 0.4-0.5 mM. Active against Gram+ bacteria B. cereus CIP 6624, B. megaterium ATCC 9885, B. stearothermophilus CIP 675, B. subtilis ATCC 6623, L. lactis ssp. cremoris I116, S. pyogenes CIP 561, S. sanguinis CIP 55128, M. luteus CIP 5345, Gram- bacteria K. pneumoniae CIP 8291, P. aeruginosa CIP A22, and fungi  S. cerevisiae LMA 720.  The comparison of ponericins with those well-studied peptides suggests that ponericins may adopt an amphipathic alpha-helical structure on cell membranes. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Orivel J, Redeker V, Le Caer JP, Krier F, Revol-Junelles AM, Longeon A, Chaffotte A, Dejean A, Rossier J.2001
Literature Information.Title: Ponericins, new antibacterial and insecticidal peptides from the venom of the ant Pachycondyla goeldii.
